contentrichtext.text: '''Sibylla of Lusignan''' (or '''Sibylle de Lusignan''') (October/November 1198 â€“ c. 1230 or 1252) was the daughter of [[Amalric II of Jerusalem]] and [[Isabella of Jerusalem]]. She was a member of the [[House of Lusignan]]. She was the second wife of King [[Leo I of Armenia]], married in 1210, by whom she had one daughter, [[Queen Isabella of Armenia|Isabella of Armenia]]. She claimed the throne of Armenia for herself after the death of her husband, who had left the throne to their infant daughter, but was exiled by the regent [[Constantine of Baberon]].<ref>[http://fmg.ac/Projects/MedLands/JERUSALEM.htm#AlixM1HuguesICyprusM2BohemondVAntioch JERUSALEM, Medieval Lands]</ref> ==Sources== * Rudt-Collenberg, W.H. ''The Rupenides, Hethumides and Lusignans'', 1963 {{reflist}} {{Persondata | name =Sibylla of Lusignan | alternative names = | short description = Armenian queen | date of birth = 1198 | place of birth = | date of death = 1230 | place of death = }} [[Category:Armenian people of Cypriot descent]] [[Category:Women of the Crusader states]] [[Category:1198 births]] [[Category:1230 deaths]] [[Category:Armenian queens consort]] [[Category:House of Lusignan]] {{Europe-hist-stub}} {{Europe-royal-stub}}
